  WORK EXPERIENCE  
 
Senior Expert , Project Manager  Hydrogen & PtX     German Energy Agency  (dena ), Berlin                                       
2022/01 – current  Senior Expert  
2020 /05 – 2021/12  Expert        
 Managed a PtX fuels  research report from acquisition to completion ( 1,5 years ); 
 Performed technical, economic, and policy analyse s of Power -to-X molecules  (PtX)  
along their value chain, with a focus on the transport sector ; 
 Advised the German government and industry on PtX and energy policy;  
 Co-authored one global energy system modeling study  and 4 policy papers ; 
 Acted as point of contact for industry and policy actors at the executive level;  
 Represented dena as a speaker at several  conferences e.g. World Hydrogen 
Congre ss, World Hydrogen Italy, Sustainable Aviation Futures Amsterdam.  
 Main results : won €350.000 in project grant s, increased peak outreach three -fold 
and network size two -fold, acquired industry and policy contacts.  
2019 /06 – 2020 /04 Working Student                     
 Wrote my Master Thesis  in cooperation with dena . 
 Methods used : Life Cycle Assessment, linear optimization . 
 
Intern, Climate Technology and Innovation                      United Nations (UNIDO),  Vienna  
2018 /09 – 2018 /12 
 Selected contractors  and allocat ed US$750 .000 to 8 biogas projects in South Africa;  
 Developed 70 quantitative and qualitative  indicators  for the evaluation of  country -
wide renewable energy  expansion  programme s; 
 Reviewed 4  college training curricula on renewable energy and ent repreneurship ; 
 Performed a technical review of a wind power  plant  design  and installation manual . 
 
Teaching and Research Assistant , Wind Power                          Berlin Inst itute  of Technology  
2018 /06 – 2018 /09 
 Co-administered a graduate project class of 85 students on wind power;  
 Assisted empirical validation research  on root-angled turbine blade s, including 
wind -tennel testing;  
 Manufactured 3D -printed  and composite blades ; 
 Designed and manufactured a portable, stand -alone drag and lift test rig, including 
an analog control panel using CAD software  and a PLA 3D printer . 
 
Junior consultant , Renewable Energy     Energy Access and Development Program , Berlin                                            
2016 /10 – 2018 /09 and 2019 /02 – 2019 /05  
 Led a group of 15 students in designing, building and installing a solar dryer in  Turkey  
(sponsor:  German Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development);  
 Awarded a US$100 .000 grant under the USAID BALADI progr amme ; 
 Developed a linear optimization model  for solar water heating system sizing;  
 Lecture d and tutored  a project class of 20 over 2 terms  on energy access;  
 Represented the organisation  at meetings, fairs and symp osiums.  
 
Team Leader  (pro bono ), Popular Science  British Interpla
